content:
Diagnosis
	1. High grade serous carcinoma of ovary, FIGO Stage IIIB
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsies

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Paclitaxel - 3 cycles completed March 2024
	2. Gemcitabine/Carboplatin - commenced April 2024

	Clinical studies
	None - BRCA2 variant of uncertain significance identified

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with deteriorating performance status

	Current issues
	Ascites requiring regular drainage
Malignant bowel obstruction
Poor oral intake
Deterioration in mobility

	Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with her daughter. Unfortunately, she has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past three weeks. Following the identification of disease progression on CT imaging in late March 2024, we switched to second-line chemotherapy with weekly Gemcitabine/Carboplatin. However, she has only managed one cycle due to declining performance status.

She now requires assistance with most activities of daily living and is spending approximately 70% of the day in bed or resting (WHO PS 3). Her main symptoms are progressive abdominal distension requiring weekly paracentesis, early satiety, and intermittent colicky abdominal pain suggesting partial bowel obstruction. She has lost a further 4kg in weight despite nutritional supplements.

CT imaging from last week shows increasing omental disease with new liver surface deposits and moderate volume ascites. CA125 has risen from 450 to 1200 over the past month.

After careful discussion with [redacted name] and her daughter, we have agreed that further systemic anti-cancer therapy would carry significant risks with limited potential benefit given her declining performance status. We have therefore made the decision to focus on symptom management and quality of life.

	Further investigations
	None planned

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 4mg daily
Cyclizine 50mg TDS
Oxycodone MR 20mg BD

	Follow up
	Referral made to palliative care team for urgent review
Weekly paracentesis as required
Telephone review by CNS in one week

	Required GP actions
	Please support palliative care referral
Prescribe anticipatory medications as recommended by palliative care team

primary_cancer.metastases: omental disease, liver surface deposits, malignant ascites

cancer_timeline.value: Disease progression identified on CT imaging
CT shows increasing omental disease with new liver surface deposits and moderate volume ascites
Decision to discontinue systemic therapy due to declining performance status

patient_facts.value: WHO PS 3, spending 70% of day in bed or resting
Progressive abdominal distension requiring weekly paracentesis
Early satiety and intermittent colicky abdominal pain
Requires assistance with most activities of daily living

status_updates.value: Stage IIIB ovarian cancer with progressive disease after first-line chemotherapy. Significant clinical deterioration with transition to palliative care due to poor performance status
Progressive disease on imaging with rising CA125 and clinical deterioration
Discontinuing systemic therapy and transitioning to palliative care focus
Significant deterioration in performance status to WHO PS 3
Urgent palliative care referral made, weekly paracentesis as needed, CNS telephone review in one week
